<denchmark-h:h2>docs do not mention their license</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-code>We had a request for somebody that wanted to use the Haar picture in a book.
The docs should mention their license so that people know they can do whatever with them.
What is it anyway ? According to: http://creativecommons.org/choose/ That would be: http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/ </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h2>History</denchmark-h>

comments.comment: Actually the Haar picture with the features is the one used in the publication, seen <denchmark-link:http://docs.opencv.org/modules/objdetect/doc/cascade_classification.html?highlight=cascade%20classifier>here</denchmark-link> . We should not encourage people to use images generated in other publications, unless they reference it correctly. So I am not sure if it is good to add a license on that content.
